name: Trinity College Dublin
shortDesc: Historic university with the Book of Kells.
tips: Go early to avoid queues. Walk around College Green and the Long Room (check availability).

name: Guinness Storehouse
shortDesc: Iconic brewery tour ending with skyline views at the Gravity Bar.
tips: Book tickets online for faster entry. Aim for sunset time if you want great views.

name: Phoenix Park
shortDesc: Massive city park with deer, trails, and wide open spaces.
tips: Best in the morning; bring water and comfy shoes. Keep distance from deer.

name: Temple Bar
shortDesc: Lively area for pubs, street music, and city vibes.
tips: Great for photos; can be busy at night. Explore nearby streets for quieter spots.

name: St Stephen’s Green
shortDesc: Beautiful central park with lakes, flowers, and calm walking paths.
tips: Perfect break between shopping and sightseeing. Visit in spring for blooms.

name: Grafton Street
shortDesc: Famous shopping street with buskers and lively energy.
tips: Walk from St Stephen’s Green to Trinity area. Listen to buskers in the afternoon.

name: Dublin Castle
shortDesc: Historic castle complex with state apartments and courtyards.
tips: Great indoor option on rainy days. Combine with Chester Beatty nearby.

name: Chester Beatty
shortDesc: Museum of manuscripts, art, and global collections (often free).
tips: Check opening hours. The café is a nice quiet stop.

name: Christ Church Cathedral
shortDesc: Iconic cathedral with medieval architecture and crypt.
tips: Visit the crypt if open. Great spot for architecture lovers.

name: St Patrick’s Cathedral
shortDesc: Ireland’s largest cathedral with beautiful interiors and park nearby.
tips: Pair with a walk in St Patrick’s Park for photos.

name: Ha’penny Bridge
shortDesc: Famous pedestrian bridge over the River Liffey.
tips: Best photos early morning or golden hour. Great short walk along the Liffey.

name: Custom House Quay
shortDesc: Elegant riverside architecture and a peaceful waterside walk.
tips: Nice area for evening strolls. Combine with Samuel Beckett Bridge.

name: Samuel Beckett Bridge
shortDesc: Modern cable-stayed bridge shaped like a harp.
tips: Great night photos when the city lights reflect on the water.

name: EPIC The Irish Emigration Museum
shortDesc: Interactive museum exploring Irish emigration stories.
tips: Good family-friendly indoor activity. Allow 1–2 hours.

name: Kilmainham Gaol
shortDesc: Historic prison museum tied to Ireland’s independence story.
tips: Tickets sell out—book ahead. Combine with IMMA nearby.

name: IMMA (Irish Museum of Modern Art)
shortDesc: Modern art museum in a beautiful historic building and gardens.
tips: Check exhibitions; the gardens are lovely for a calm walk.

name: Howth Cliff Walk
shortDesc: Coastal cliff walk with stunning sea views near Dublin.
tips: Bring a jacket—windy even in summer. Great day trip by DART.

name: Howth Harbour
shortDesc: Harbour with seafood spots, boats, and relaxing sea views.
tips: Try fish & chips. Visit after the cliff walk for sunset.

name: Dún Laoghaire Pier
shortDesc: Long coastal pier walk with fresh sea air and views.
tips: Perfect for an easy walk. Great on clear evenings.

name: National Gallery of Ireland
shortDesc: Major art gallery with Irish and European masterpieces (often free).
tips: Great rainy-day spot. Check if special exhibitions require tickets.

name: National Museum of Ireland (Archaeology)
shortDesc: Fascinating archaeology museum with Celtic artifacts (often free).
tips: Don’t miss the bog bodies section. Good for 1–2 hours.

name: The Little Museum of Dublin
shortDesc: Small museum packed with Dublin stories and quirky objects.
tips: Guided tours are fun and short. Great if you’re limited on time.

name: Teeling Whiskey Distillery
shortDesc: Modern whiskey distillery experience in the Liberties.
tips: Book ahead if you want a tasting session. Great alternative to Guinness.

name: Stoneybatter
shortDesc: Trendy neighbourhood with cafés, pubs, and local food spots.
tips: Great for brunch. Explore side streets for hidden cafés.

name: Powerscourt Townhouse Centre
shortDesc: Elegant shopping and café spot inside a Georgian townhouse.
tips: Nice indoor stop near Grafton Street. Great for a coffee break.

name: Merrion Square
shortDesc: Georgian square with a peaceful park and city history nearby.
tips: Great spot for a calm break. Nearby museums make it easy to combine.
